answers.answer: Fasting levels between 100-125 mg/dl is considered prediabetes, above diabetes. You can reverse this to normal by changing your eating habits [restrict carbohydrate intake, avoid sugars and foods made with white flour], 30-60 minutes of daily exercise, and maintain normal body weight and Lipid panel.A level of 217 mg/dl is high. Unless we know when you captured this no further comments can be made. Post back and let us know if it was random, preprandial [before a meal], or postprandial 2-3 hours after a meal]. If the latter tell us what you ate.
a level of 217 was a result of test taken postprandial...and i ate meat that time for lunch..and my fasting sugar level was 112....so plz let me know how serious or mild is my condition...thank u...

A Postprandial level of 217 mg/dl is unhealthy and leads to complications in the future. When responding it is important to tell the entire story not just a portion. Meat by itself, unless marinated in a sugary substance, will not elevate your blood sugars this high.A fasting level of 112 mg/dl is considered prediabetes. If you continue your current lifestyle by not making the necessary lifestyle changes you will become a diabetic. Currently there is no cure for diabetes.

I agree with WaveRider; the postprandial was way too high. But you did not just eat meat for lunch. Meat has no carbs and won't raise your glucose. What was with the meat? Potatoes, bread, fruits, etc. all have carbs and will raise your readings. Also, what did you drink with the meal? Soda? Sweet tea? Coffee with sugar and creamer? You need to watch everything you take into your mouth! Write it down and keep a log of food intake, exercise and meter readings so that you can track what is going on with your body. Good luck.
